_microblog.bio: üåø Samuel Lison | Nature Photographer & Hiker üèûÔ∏è | Exploring #fungi, #landscapes, & #outdoors. Sharing #photography, #hikes, & mindful moments. üéíüì∏ #NaturePhotography #HikingAdventures #TheSporeTrail

items.content_html:
@axxuy Welcome home. It‚Äôs expected that the universe would serve the world a broken website as soon as you walk out the door to a place where you can do nothing about it. Why wouldn‚Äôt it?

It‚Äôs also interesting that this happened on the one post you were blogging for attention for!
@gtronix thanks :) Never heard of it, interesting device.
@ai6yr Lynx - Shower in a can.
@n1ghtw1re pleasure. Your writing gets me thinking all the time :)

@ai6yr interesting. It‚Äôs like they try to do here in Australia with EV‚Äôs. Tax by km‚Äôs/miles driven for the year as part of your registration renewal, because they lost out on taxing you at the fuel pump.
@ai6yr my eldest is 10, still on the iPad. But I have a setup upstairs that I will use for her high school period and it will have Linux to learn on. Allbeit an easier distro but still.
@jonah what is that? lol

@ai6yr Eww, windows. Although I did like Windows 3.1 and 95 back in the day on my old green 1995 Acer Aspire with Voice Control‚Ä¶ It was ahead of its time! www.bloomberg.com/news/arti‚Ä¶

Now though, all Linux.
@codinghorror thanks for sharing that. That‚Äôs made my morning. Changing my usual PC playlist from Lo-Fi to some Smooth Jazz.
@mangatake productive day you had :)
@manton air pump? You need to put money in to get air for your tires?
@jonah haven‚Äôt seen this series. Looks like another I need to add to my list?
@codinghorror I need to watch it. How do you make choices if it‚Äôs a version hosted on someones Emby server and not Netflix üßê

@ai6yr hmmm I carry 10 x less than that on the daily as I‚Äôve gone back to cash, FROM cashless. But 3k is excessive. $300 seems to be a good sweet spot to cover most needs and reduces the risk of being robbed of so much more I guess.
@axxuy second person. Happened to Manton of micro.blog. He went out and the whole service went off the rails from an old memory leak!
@manton that‚Äôs usually how the universe decides to deliver things :D

@mangatake Yeah it‚Äôs tough not being able to get good results for your clients. It‚Äôs a shame really, and I feel like a lot of areas of work in government and more so in mental health, is just tick and flick. A lot of covering your own back side, then the client is just left there with no outcome.

Hopefully I‚Äôll find work I love like you do :)

Well hopefully you will find work you love. But, you aren‚Äôt going to find it if you haven‚Äôt got that CV/Resume finished yet! Did you end up finishing that task? üòâ
@mangatake haha, all good. Now we are even, although I think my assumption of you was worse than yours of mine.
@mangatake it‚Äôs normal in General Duties roles. I can get more steady hours if I go to certain specialist departments. But generally yes, it‚Äôs normal.
@mangatake ah, that could be why indeed.
@mangatake the weather over there anything to do with it?

@mangatake sometimes I wonder if doing long-term night shift is a little better, as you get into a routine. Instead of stopping and starting. It‚Äôs already bad enough going from 2 days afternoon shifts, to 1 day shift, day off, 3 day shifts, 2 afternoons etc etc randomly!

@mangatake yes of course. People are heightened in most jobs, as, if we are attending, usually it‚Äôs during someones worst moments. So someone that may appear to be compliant and friendly, suddenly can latch out and attack in fear that everything is over. So we are always careful of any indicators in body language, stance etc. But it‚Äôs still hard to tell as majority of the time, everything is fine, so it‚Äôs easy to get complacent.
@techlore that‚Äôs concerning! Will make people think twice though, about how much they share online.
@wplalonde these things are a pest where we are. They love leaving their markings all over solar panels :D They always pick our roof being a two story.
@mangatake thanks. Relatively calm, but our final night was actually quite full on! Mostly domestic violence though, as predicted. But also burnt out car tonight (not a Tesla).
@mangatake üôå

@n1ghtw1re haha made me watch the trailer for this movie and then realised that Duke Nukems, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs time to kick ass and chew bubblegum, and I‚Äôm all outta gum‚Äù came from this movie, as does Duke Nukems looks. Actually think the whole game is moddled around this movie!
@manton or an inbox where replies sit, so you can moderate/curate what will get printed on your personal domain permanently.

@n1ghtw1re I believe the take down of that department actually commenced prior to Trump, back in December, by Biden. But regardless, any agency responsible for ‚Äúmisinformation‚Äù taken down, is a win for the internet in my book. I don‚Äôt trust any politician, ever. Their name doesn‚Äôt need to start with T or E.

@n1ghtw1re That‚Äôs good. The internet should be a decentralised federation of information, free from control by any country or person. Censorship is as harmful as misinformation‚Äîpeople shouldn‚Äôt need the Dark Web to access all perspectives, true or not. No country should decide what I can or cannot access. Instead, efforts should focus on providing tools and education to help people evaluate information critically.

@GrapheneOS nah I love that. I block all unknown numbers, and block all numbers not in my contact list. My voicemail specifically says (in an AI voice I generated) that I do not answer calls from unknown numbers and if it‚Äôs important and want a call back, to leave a voicemail - or sms - or email.

Anyone important enough is on my contacts and/or knows emergency numbers to reach me on.

@codinghorror didn‚Äôt like Demon 79 - I did like Joan is Awful though, will agree there :)

I‚Äôve only watched 4 episodes of Season 7 - but I have liked all 4 episodes thus far.
@mangatake breaking the mental barrier and pushing yourself just to go, is a win!

@manton the pixelfed cross-posting still will not work for me, but with a different error now:

Could not connect to the Pixelfed instance photos.familylison.com. Make sure you have entered only the hostname.

No errors in the logs. I‚Äôve tried different browsers too.

@codinghorror interesting that we diverse there. I hated Season 6 and thought it took away from the whole series, couldn‚Äôt watch it anymore. I love Season 7 and brings me back to the original Season 1 Episodes.

@mangatake it has pros and cons. Have to use it wisely. Because compartmentalising can lead you to just slowly filling up a bucket with traumatic jobs, stressful paperwork and policies and every other little thing. If not managed, you could get to a point of overfilling that bucket where you‚Äôve had enough and can no longer manage even the smallest things. So I suppose, this here & journaling, are a method of putting holes on the bottom of that bucket to relieve some junk.

@news hey guys, kind of fixed but not. I know longer get the previous error, but now get:

Could not connect to the Pixelfed instance photos.familylison.com. Make sure you have entered only the hostname.

@mangatake I‚Äôm pretty good with detaching and keeping work and life personalities completely compartmentalised at the moment. I just find it interesting that fully grown adults, don‚Äôt know how to adult and respect each other.

Accidents do happen, though mostly during peak hour or when the weather changes but drivers don‚Äôt change their manner of driving.

We do get crime, and domestic violence usually has crimes attached too. I just find those are the most common in my locality.

@mangatake sounds to me like you have a well thought out plan and have been following it for some time now. Speak to a psychiatrist would not hurt and may lead you in other directions to offer you solutions without the mind numbing drugs.

Maybe they‚Äôll offer a session on mushrooms and music if it‚Äôs legal where you are‚Ä¶ Known as Psychedelic Assisted Therapy.

@mangatake I‚Äôm no medical expert, but reducing anti-depressants on your own, gradually and seeing how you cope mentally is a challenging process and quite courageous of you. As long as you monitor it and control your state. I‚Äôm anti big-pharma myself, so being able to come off something like that, and dig into your core issues on your own without reliance on a drug - that‚Äôs where real things happen. Could be good; could also be bad. Your journaling you‚Äôve been doing though, will keep you guided and hopefully grounded.

@mangatake hmm, hard to answer that one. In the area I work, generally nights allow for catch up on some of our work. But, generally (especially when the full moon is out), we get more violence due to drinking, or mental health, or even burglaries at opportune times. I find the busiest times though are mornings just before people head off to work, and nights prior to people getting to bed. Partners inevitably arguing with each other, escalating to a point of losing control. Mostly for me it is domestic violence we deal with unfortunately.
@mangatake glad I did not offend you then :)

@manton @grubz violence you are also inevitably hurting people with the same opinions as you and would stand with you at a protest, but you‚Äôve gone and targeted someone based on a brand they chose to purchase prior to all this occurring in the first place. So then you lost that potential supporter to your cause due to the struggles, stress and pressure you have put onto their lives due to your stupidity and hatred.

You‚Äôre attacking your own people, who you need to stand with you, not against you.

@mangatake haha all good. I don‚Äôt even know how or why I assumed a gender to begin with, so my apologies with that! Maybe the name ‚ÄúQuesta‚Äù gave me some assumption, which was wrong on my part anyway as well.
@AthanSpod downer‚Ä¶ I need a shrink it‚Äôs that much of a downer. Anyone offering a free 30 minute online session? I need to recalibrate and reground - feel like I had a bad trip on #shrooms.
@johnallsopp that‚Äôs an interesting way to look at it. We are already there, how could it get worse.

@lilstevie I definitely did not like Season 6. It went backwards. I think Episode 1 is good in Season 7 and comes back to Season 1‚Äôs strange roots. But I haven‚Äôt gone on to watch the next ones just yet. Need to go see my shrink first.

@codinghorror I dunno, I just posted a note saying Episode 1 of Season 7 was actually quite disturbing and I enjoyed it for that reason. It took a while to warm up for me, but:

The new #BlackMirror season is crazy.
@mangatake you seem like a genuine bloke trying to be there for people even with your own things to take care of.
@mangatake thank you. I made it through, but ready for some sleep!

@TimWardCam They‚Äôll legislate a ‚Äúbackdoor‚Äù to make it the providers problem. And because there‚Äôs no way to do it, they‚Äôll just be forced to disable E2EE or cop a fine for not enabling an impossible backdoor?

Or, do they make it so the central server has its own copy of the private keys that are created on each device on creation of a conversation/group/room.
@manton wow! That‚Äôs a neat feature to have.

@mangatake yeah, it‚Äôs pretty cool - no longer have to log into a website and type into an input box to make a post to the fedi. I can do it direct from the Obsidian app as Markdown. Then it uploads to the fedi and to my website (https://samuellison.com/2025/04/13/ok-i-got-obsidian-working.html) - but to see a reply I either have to go to my website and refresh the page or log into my fediverse account of course. And replying is still done through a website too heh. But still cool!

@manton indeed. I haven‚Äôt been able to find any open source solutions available that allows that though and allows for self-hosting. Micro.blog is the closest thing. It would not be easy to just export out of Micro.blog and keep my fediverse identity going at the same time with all the backend work Micro.blog does on ActivityPub I think. Easy to keep the content, but not the fediverse side, timeline, follows etc.

@mangatake One of the ways, yes - and writing out blogs and microblogs is a way to wind down as well. But it‚Äôs too easy to procrastinate once I sit down in the home office and turn on the screen, as I‚Äôve always loved computers and the internet!
@dansup I like Jake. Tends to rhyme with Drake too ;)
@mangatake oh very, love this job. I‚Äôm in emergency services here in Australia as a first responder.
@jupiter_rowland sure can :)
@mangatake hmm yes, Vitamin D it is. I‚Äôm starting Night Shift tomorrow for a week, so midday sleeps will be me!

@mangatake strange - it‚Äôs suppose to automatically move my followers over to this one. Thanks for letting me know that it works now though! I was getting worried I‚Äôd be posting out into the #void of the fediverse once again and rebuilding!

@news I am still getting an error when I try to re-add my Pixelfed instance :(
‚ÄúError while processing the request. Please try again or email help@micro.blog. Check the news blog for updates.‚Äù
@theresmiling looking good!
@mangatake you sure it‚Äôs not the ol‚Äô age that‚Äôs getting to ya for the midday naps? Cause that‚Äôs me :D
@mangatake haha, yeah. I‚Äôm kind of glad I didn‚Äôt grow up with smart phones and tablets. Having my first PC with MS DOS on it and fiddling around with BBS systems was bad enough!
@FediTips wow, how cool is that??!!
@shellsharks you‚Äôre appreciated. You‚Äôve surely made my journey more enjoyable!

@manton Well thought out post. I felt exactly the same way about Mastodon.

I have my own instance, and I also use micro.blog and was ‚ÄúSyndicating‚Äù to my Mastodon instance.

But then, what is the point, when I can just use my own domain name and my fediverse identity created through Micro.blog? @samuel.

So I used the Migration tool on my Mastodon instance to let people know which account they should be following.

Yes, I lose my posts on the instance - but thankfully I‚Äôve been using micro.blog for a while now and was cross-posting. Which means I have all the original posts still on my website and backed up to github and able to move where I wish, should I ever need to.

Owning your own content has never been more important than now.
@gtronix concerning. All it takes is one state or country to pass it, and others follow. Australia passed the age bill for social media with the world watching. Now look at where we all are.

@MakerTube yeah it is a weird one. Doesn‚Äôt explain why my own makertube fedi alias would be posting about other peoples videos (who I don‚Äôt follow on any accounts). Yet, the makertube account made no such post. A #glitch somewhere in the #matrix.
@claralistensprechen5th interesting. Thank you for clarifying :)

@shankulkarny Not as lonely out there as you think. I‚Äôve found the indieweb has brought me back my feelings of what social media should be. The people that read and respond, more genuine.

If I post on Facebook, or X - I get nothing. They are people endlessly scrolling for something to do, looking at their phones out in public due to anxiety of being around others looking at their phones.

A blog post, like yours, is read by people who subscribe to your RSS, unknown to you, lurking, reading and enjoying every word.

@claralistensprechen5th yeah, I am replying and reading through micro.blog and there is a link to ‚Äúconversation‚Äù which I can click and see the whole conversation and should have done that initially before responding. I am new to this #fediverse thing :D

Maybe replies shouldn‚Äôt automatically show up in all your followers feeds by default as they are not really part of that specific conversation.

@unusnemo same boat here. Annoying that all I see in my timeline is a response to someone‚Äôs post. Because I follow you and not the OP. I either have to click directly on your response or click on ‚Äúconversation‚Äù (in micro.blog) to open the full thread, or at least, what‚Äôs loaded on this instance.

Confusing, if you ask me.

It‚Äôs like listening in to your conversations and not actually being a part of it - then jumping in!

@unusnemo oh all good, my apologies. I should have read the full conversation and not just reply direct to yours post (it‚Äôs all I saw in my timeline!). I agree, most moderation is not used widely, or wisely. I‚Äôve not used Friendica as yet either.

Even for mid sized servers, the weakness of decentralized servers is most are run by regular you and I‚Äôs who aren‚Äôt professional moderators and don‚Äôt run social media as a business. Hobby servers with limited funds.

@techlore ah black mirror indeed. A lot of new cars do this now, not just Waymo. I have a black tape on my camera (Tesla which no one has burnt yet as it‚Äôs not parked in the easiest of spots to target!) - They also sell data back to insurers in some countries!
@unusnemo love that. Is that your own instance‚Äôs terminal?

@unusnemo kids can moderate all they like on their instances, makes no difference to anyone. All moderation does, is local to that instance.

Larger instances however would benefit from a good moderation system, as it‚Äôs also more about moderating your own userbase and content going in and out of your instance. Not moderating ends your instance unfederated from other servers. Also if your membership is open, you want to prevent illegal content, as you are responsible.

@mangatake nah, looks like all good now! No errors on the systems and all setup with UPS now. It‚Äôs the first time that kind of surge has happened to me at this location in the 15 odd years I have been here.

@mangatake I know those feelings - but if that‚Äôs what‚Äôs holding you back to just get out there, it‚Äôll keep on holding you back. You can still make it ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù, send it off to a few people, adjust, and adjust until you are happy (as you go) - like personal sites are never done ;)
@MakerTube will email you what occured :)
@slison and now its back to normal as if nothing happened‚Ä¶. Got a screenshot of my timeline though that shows the weird glitch.

@MakerTube - has something happened to your instance? Your website is down and I‚Äôve been spammed with videos uploaded to my own accounts on your service? @thesporetrail? I use 2FA and strong passwords. Has your server been breached?
@MakerTube did something happen to your instance? Looks like your website is down and my own identity on MakerTube.net is spamming me with videos I never uploaded? @thesporetrail ?

@slison
I don‚Äôt think playing Roblox in itself is an issue, but my youngest daughters addiction and dependence on it is. I use to go through that with my computer game addictions and still feel drawn to this day to be sitting at a computer and passing my days on it.

@tek not sure how these bug bounty programs work. But I‚Äôd be disclosing it without getting into too much detail as to the ‚Äúhow to‚Äù and let their reputation take a hit for not taking action on something so serious. With data breaches and the likes being such big news, negligence on their part doesn‚Äôt look good now does it?

@mangatake What‚Äôs keeping you from getting the last part done? Are you open to using any AI, even if it‚Äôs just it giving you ‚Äútips‚Äù on how to improve it a tad more but not change your words. Instead of using AI to do the thing for you, use it to look over it and provide you tips?

@mangatake actually no they are not. We only had the two and a third didn‚Äôt occur. Not sure what caused it or if it was just this house - it wasn‚Äôt even so cold or hot that neighbourhood‚Äôs power consumption would put extra load on the grid. So I am not sure?
@slison actually exciting to get new tech :P
@jakeweidokal I bet! Are things looking any better over there? I only get to read the media from here in Australia.

@drahardja the beauty about the Fediverse though, is that you are never truly blocked. But I just wanted to add, blocking someone for replying respectfully (not trolling), to your public post, is quite weak, IMHO.

Anyway, I‚Äôve eternally hosted your post on my own website to remind me that the world is full of sensitive people who really should not make social media posts, if they aren‚Äôt willing to have discussions.

I do love my Tesla though :)
@hermosawave agreed!
@hermosawave agree with you there! Never too late!
@fortyseven I wonder when the crypto thing will collapse again and all these people jumping in realise it was another big hype? Or should we also be jumping onto this bandwagon?
@lukelukeluke.bsky.social This is a photo from one of my final walks before they all vanished
@lukelukeluke.bsky.social They are beautiful. I can‚Äôt wait for Autumn to come back past in Australia. It‚Äôs rare to find them in summer here and I want to practice my photography skills.
@lukelukeluke.bsky.social But the plants need your CO2 to survive too ;)
@lukelukeluke.bsky.social Sounds like a trip :D

@samuellison.bsky.social I have nothing against them either. I am pro-trump personally, but I don‚Äôt need to be fed with propaganda all day. I am specifically trying to get it all off my feed! Oh well.
@samuellison.bsky.social Thanks!
